trans-unit.source: SharePoint Server 2013 farm Phase 2 | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: SharePoint Server 2013 farm Phase 2 | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Create and configure the two Active Directory replica domain controllers in Phase 2 of the SharePoint Server 2013 farm in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Create and configure the two Active Directory replica domain controllers in Phase 2 of the SharePoint Server 2013 farm in Azure.

trans-unit.source: SharePoint Intranet Farm Workload Phase 2: Configure domain controllers
trans-unit.target: SharePoint Intranet Farm Workload Phase 2: Configure domain controllers

trans-unit.source: In this phase of deploying an intranet-only SharePoint 2013 farm with SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure infrastructure services, you configure two domain controllers in the Azure virtual network in Service Management.
trans-unit.target: In this phase of deploying an intranet-only SharePoint 2013 farm with SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure infrastructure services, you configure two domain controllers in the Azure virtual network in Service Management.

trans-unit.source: Client web requests for SharePoint farm resources can then be authenticated in the Azure virtual network, rather than sending that authentication traffic across the VPN or Azure ExpressRoute connection to your on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: Client web requests for SharePoint farm resources can then be authenticated in the Azure virtual network, rather than sending that authentication traffic across the VPN or Azure ExpressRoute connection to your on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: You must complete this phase before moving on to [Phase 3](virtual-machines-workload-intranet-sharepoint-phase3.md).
trans-unit.target: You must complete this phase before moving on to [Phase 3](virtual-machines-workload-intranet-sharepoint-phase3.md).

trans-unit.source: See [Deploying SharePoint with SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure](virtual-machines-workload-intranet-sharepoint-overview.md) for all of the phases.
trans-unit.target: See [Deploying SharePoint with SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure](virtual-machines-workload-intranet-sharepoint-overview.md) for all of the phases.

trans-unit.source: Create the domain controller virtual machines in Azure
trans-unit.target: Create the domain controller virtual machines in Azure

trans-unit.source: First, you need to fill out the **Virtual machine name** column of Table M and modify virtual machine sizes as needed in the **Minimum size** column.
trans-unit.target: First, you need to fill out the **Virtual machine name** column of Table M and modify virtual machine sizes as needed in the **Minimum size** column.

trans-unit.source: Item
trans-unit.target: Item

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine name
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine name

trans-unit.source: Gallery image
trans-unit.target: Gallery image

trans-unit.source: Minimum size
trans-unit.target: Minimum size

trans-unit.target: ______________ (first domain controller, example DC1)

trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter

trans-unit.target: A2 (Medium)

trans-unit.source: ______________ (second domain controller, example DC2)
trans-unit.target: ______________ (second domain controller, example DC2)

trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter

trans-unit.source: A2 (Medium)
trans-unit.target: A2 (Medium)

trans-unit.target: ______________ (first SQL Server computer, example SQL1)

trans-unit.target: A7

trans-unit.target: ______________ (second SQL Server computer, example SQL2)

trans-unit.target: Microsoft SQL Server 2014 Enterprise – Windows Server 2012 R2

trans-unit.source: A7
trans-unit.target: A7

trans-unit.target: ______________ (majority node witness for the cluster, example MN1)

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012 R2 Datacenter

trans-unit.source: A1 (Small)
trans-unit.target: A1 (Small)

trans-unit.target: ______________ (first SharePoint application server, example APP1)

trans-unit.target: A4 (ExtraLarge)

trans-unit.target: A4 (ExtraLarge)

trans-unit.target: A4 (ExtraLarge)

trans-unit.target: A4 (ExtraLarge)

trans-unit.source: Table M – Virtual machines for the SharePoint 2013 intranet farm in Azure
trans-unit.target: Table M – Virtual machines for the SharePoint 2013 intranet farm in Azure

trans-unit.source: For the complete list of virtual machine sizes, see [Sizes for virtual machines](virtual-machines-size-specs.md).
trans-unit.target: For the complete list of virtual machine sizes, see [Sizes for virtual machines](virtual-machines-size-specs.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the following block of Azure PowerShell commands to create the virtual machines for the two domain controllers.
trans-unit.target: Use the following block of Azure PowerShell commands to create the virtual machines for the two domain controllers.

trans-unit.source: Specify the values for the variables, removing the < and > characters.
trans-unit.target: Specify the values for the variables, removing the < and > characters.

trans-unit.source: Note that this Azure PowerShell command set uses values from the following:
trans-unit.target: Note that this Azure PowerShell command set uses values from the following:

trans-unit.source: Table M, for your virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Table M, for your virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Table V, for your virtual network settings
trans-unit.target: Table V, for your virtual network settings

trans-unit.source: Table S, for your subnet
trans-unit.target: Table S, for your subnet

trans-unit.source: Table A, for your availability sets
trans-unit.target: Table A, for your availability sets

trans-unit.source: Table C, for your cloud services
trans-unit.target: Table C, for your cloud services

trans-unit.source: Recall that you defined Tables V, S, A, and C in [Phase 1: Configure Azure](virtual-machines-workload-intranet-sharepoint-phase1.md).
trans-unit.target: Recall that you defined Tables V, S, A, and C in [Phase 1: Configure Azure](virtual-machines-workload-intranet-sharepoint-phase1.md).

trans-unit.source: When you have supplied all the proper values, run the resulting block at the Azure PowerShell command prompt.
trans-unit.target: When you have supplied all the proper values, run the resulting block at the Azure PowerShell command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Configure the first domain controller
trans-unit.target: Configure the first domain controller

trans-unit.source: Log on to the first domain controller computer by using the credentials of the local administrator account.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the first domain controller computer by using the credentials of the local administrator account.

trans-unit.source: To log on to a virtual machine by using a Remote Desktop connection
trans-unit.target: To log on to a virtual machine by using a Remote Desktop connection

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, in the left pane, click **Virtual Machines**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, in the left pane, click **Virtual Machines**.

trans-unit.source: To connect to a VM, click **Running** in the **Status** column next to its name.
trans-unit.target: To connect to a VM, click **Running** in the **Status** column next to its name.

trans-unit.source: In the command bar on the bottom of the page, click **Connect**.
trans-unit.target: In the command bar on the bottom of the page, click **Connect**.

trans-unit.source: The portal informs you that the .rdp file is being retrieved.
trans-unit.target: The portal informs you that the .rdp file is being retrieved.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: The browser dialog appears, asking "Do you want to open or save ComputerName.rdp from manage.windowsazure.com?"
trans-unit.target: The browser dialog appears, asking "Do you want to open or save ComputerName.rdp from manage.windowsazure.com?"

trans-unit.source: Click **Open**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Open**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Remote Desktop Connection** dialog, click **Connect**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Remote Desktop Connection** dialog, click **Connect**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Windows Security** dialog, click **Use another account**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Windows Security** dialog, click **Use another account**.

trans-unit.source: In **User name**, type the name of the VM and user name of the local administrator account created with the VM (a local machine account).
trans-unit.target: In **User name**, type the name of the VM and user name of the local administrator account created with the VM (a local machine account).

trans-unit.source: Use the following format: *ComputerName*\\*LocalAdministratorAccountName*
trans-unit.target: Use the following format: *ComputerName*\\*LocalAdministratorAccountName*

trans-unit.source: In **Password**, type the password for the local administrator account.
trans-unit.target: In **Password**, type the password for the local administrator account.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Remote Desktop Connection** dialog, click **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Remote Desktop Connection** dialog, click **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: The desktop of the new machine appears in a Remote Desktop session window.
trans-unit.target: The desktop of the new machine appears in a Remote Desktop session window.

trans-unit.source: Next, you need to add the extra data disk to the first domain controller.
trans-unit.target: Next, you need to add the extra data disk to the first domain controller.

trans-unit.source: To initialize an empty disk
trans-unit.target: To initialize an empty disk

trans-unit.source: In the left pane of Server Manager, click **File and Storage Services**, and then click **Disks**.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane of Server Manager, click **File and Storage Services**, and then click **Disks**.

trans-unit.source: In the contents pane, in the **Disks** group, click disk **2** (with the **Partition** set to **Unknown**).
trans-unit.target: In the contents pane, in the **Disks** group, click disk **2** (with the **Partition** set to **Unknown**).

trans-unit.source: Click **Tasks**, and then click **New Volume**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Tasks**, and then click **New Volume**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Before you begin** page of the New Volume Wizard, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Before you begin** page of the New Volume Wizard, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Select the server and disk** page, click **Disk 2**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Select the server and disk** page, click **Disk 2**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Specify the size of the volume** page, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Specify the size of the volume** page, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Assign to a drive letter or folder** page, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Assign to a drive letter or folder** page, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Select file system settings** page, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Select file system settings** page, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Confirm selections** page, click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Confirm selections** page, click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: When initialization is complete, click **Close**.
trans-unit.target: When initialization is complete, click **Close**.

trans-unit.source: Next, test the first domain controller's connectivity to locations on your organization network.
trans-unit.target: Next, test the first domain controller's connectivity to locations on your organization network.

trans-unit.source: To test connectivity
trans-unit.target: To test connectivity

trans-unit.source: From the desktop, open a Windows PowerShell command prompt.
trans-unit.target: From the desktop, open a Windows PowerShell command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Use the **ping** command to ping names and IP addresses of resources on your organization network.
trans-unit.target: Use the **ping** command to ping names and IP addresses of resources on your organization network.

trans-unit.source: This procedure ensures that DNS name resolution is working correctly (that the virtual machine is correctly configured with on-premises DNS servers) and that packets can be sent to and from the cross-premises virtual network.
trans-unit.target: This procedure ensures that DNS name resolution is working correctly (that the virtual machine is correctly configured with on-premises DNS servers) and that packets can be sent to and from the cross-premises virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Next, from the Windows PowerShell command prompt on the first domain controller, run the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Next, from the Windows PowerShell command prompt on the first domain controller, run the following commands:

trans-unit.source: The computer will restart.
trans-unit.target: The computer will restart.

trans-unit.source: Configure the second domain controller
trans-unit.target: Configure the second domain controller

trans-unit.source: Log on to the second domain controller computer by using the credentials of its local administrator account.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the second domain controller computer by using the credentials of its local administrator account.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see the [Logging on to a virtual machine with a Remote Desktop connection procedure](#logon).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see the [Logging on to a virtual machine with a Remote Desktop connection procedure](#logon).

trans-unit.source: Next, you need to add the extra data disk to the second domain controller.
trans-unit.target: Next, you need to add the extra data disk to the second domain controller.

trans-unit.source: See the [To initialize an empty disk procedure](#datadisk).
trans-unit.target: See the [To initialize an empty disk procedure](#datadisk).

trans-unit.source: Next, test your connectivity to locations on your organization network from the second domain controller.
trans-unit.target: Next, test your connectivity to locations on your organization network from the second domain controller.

trans-unit.source: See the [To test connectivity procedure](#testconn).
trans-unit.target: See the [To test connectivity procedure](#testconn).

trans-unit.source: Use this procedure to ensure that DNS name resolution is working correctly (that the virtual machine is correctly configured with on-premises DNS servers) and that packets can be sent to and from the cross-premises virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Use this procedure to ensure that DNS name resolution is working correctly (that the virtual machine is correctly configured with on-premises DNS servers) and that packets can be sent to and from the cross-premises virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Next, from the Windows PowerShell command prompt on the second domain controller, run the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Next, from the Windows PowerShell command prompt on the second domain controller, run the following commands:

trans-unit.source: The computer will restart.
trans-unit.target: The computer will restart.

trans-unit.source: Configure SharePoint farm accounts and permissions
trans-unit.target: Configure SharePoint farm accounts and permissions

trans-unit.source: The SharePoint farm will need the following user accounts:
trans-unit.target: The SharePoint farm will need the following user accounts:

trans-unit.source: sp_farm: A user account for managing SharePoint farms.
trans-unit.target: sp_farm: A user account for managing SharePoint farms.

trans-unit.source: sp_farm_db: A user account that has sysadmin rights on SQL Server instances.
trans-unit.target: sp_farm_db: A user account that has sysadmin rights on SQL Server instances.

trans-unit.source: sp_install: A user account that has domain administration rights needed for installing roles and features.
trans-unit.target: sp_install: A user account that has domain administration rights needed for installing roles and features.

trans-unit.source: sqlservice: A user account that SQL Server instances can run as.
trans-unit.target: sqlservice: A user account that SQL Server instances can run as.

trans-unit.source: Next, log on to any computer with a domain administrator account for the domain for which the domain controllers are members, open an administrator-level Windows PowerShell command prompt, and run these commands *one at a time*:
trans-unit.target: Next, log on to any computer with a domain administrator account for the domain for which the domain controllers are members, open an administrator-level Windows PowerShell command prompt, and run these commands *one at a time*:

trans-unit.source: For each command, you will be prompted to enter a password.
trans-unit.target: For each command, you will be prompted to enter a password.

trans-unit.source: Record these account names and passwords and store them in a secure location.
trans-unit.target: Record these account names and passwords and store them in a secure location.

trans-unit.source: Next, perform the following steps to add more account properties to the new user accounts.
trans-unit.target: Next, perform the following steps to add more account properties to the new user accounts.

trans-unit.source: From the Start screen, type **Active Directory Users**, and then click **Active Directory Users and Computers**.
trans-unit.target: From the Start screen, type **Active Directory Users**, and then click **Active Directory Users and Computers**.

trans-unit.source: In the tree pane, open your domain, and then click **Users**.
trans-unit.target: In the tree pane, open your domain, and then click **Users**.

trans-unit.source: In the contents pane, right-click **sp_install**, and then click **Add to a group**.
trans-unit.target: In the contents pane, right-click **sp_install**, and then click **Add to a group**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Select Groups** dialog, type **domain admins**, and then click **OK** twice.
trans-unit.target: In the **Select Groups** dialog, type **domain admins**, and then click **OK** twice.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog, click **View and click Advanced Features**.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog, click **View and click Advanced Features**.

trans-unit.source: The option lets you see all hidden containers and hidden tabs in the property windows for Active Directory objects.
trans-unit.target: The option lets you see all hidden containers and hidden tabs in the property windows for Active Directory objects.

trans-unit.source: Right-click your domain name and click **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click your domain name and click **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Properties** dialog, click the **Security** tab, and then click the **Advanced** button.
trans-unit.target: In the **Properties** dialog, click the **Security** tab, and then click the **Advanced** button.

trans-unit.source: In the **Advanced Security settings for <YourDomain>** window, click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Advanced Security settings for <YourDomain>** window, click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Permission Entry for <YourDomain>** window, click **Select a principal**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Permission Entry for <YourDomain>** window, click **Select a principal**.

trans-unit.source: In the text box, type **<YourDomain>\sp_install**, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the text box, type **<YourDomain>\sp_install**, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Allow** for **Create computer objects**, and then click **OK** three times.
trans-unit.target: Select **Allow** for **Create computer objects**, and then click **OK** three times.

trans-unit.source: Next, update the DNS servers for your virtual network so that Azure assigns virtual machines the IP addresses of the two new domain controllers to use as their DNS servers.
trans-unit.target: Next, update the DNS servers for your virtual network so that Azure assigns virtual machines the IP addresses of the two new domain controllers to use as their DNS servers.

trans-unit.source: Note that this procedure uses values from Table V (for your virtual network settings).
trans-unit.target: Note that this procedure uses values from Table V (for your virtual network settings).

trans-unit.source: In the left pane of the Azure portal, click **Networks**, and then click the name of your virtual network (Table V – Item 1 – Value column).
trans-unit.target: In the left pane of the Azure portal, click **Networks**, and then click the name of your virtual network (Table V – Item 1 – Value column).

trans-unit.source: Click **Configure**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Configure**.

trans-unit.source: In **DNS Servers**, remove the entries corresponding to the DNS servers that are located on your on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: In **DNS Servers**, remove the entries corresponding to the DNS servers that are located on your on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: In **DNS Servers**, add two entries with friendly names and the IP addresses of these two table items:
trans-unit.target: In **DNS Servers**, add two entries with friendly names and the IP addresses of these two table items:

trans-unit.source: Table V – Item 6 – Value column
trans-unit.target: Table V – Item 6 – Value column

trans-unit.source: Table V – Item 7 – Value column
trans-unit.target: Table V – Item 7 – Value column

trans-unit.source: In the command bar at the bottom, click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: In the command bar at the bottom, click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane of the Azure portal, click **Virtual Machines**, and then click the **Status** column next to the name of your first domain controller.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane of the Azure portal, click **Virtual Machines**, and then click the **Status** column next to the name of your first domain controller.

trans-unit.source: In the command bar, click **Restart**.
trans-unit.target: In the command bar, click **Restart**.

trans-unit.source: When the first domain controller is started, click the **Status** column next to the name of your second domain controller.
trans-unit.target: When the first domain controller is started, click the **Status** column next to the name of your second domain controller.

trans-unit.source: In the command bar, click **Restart**.
trans-unit.target: In the command bar, click **Restart**.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the second domain controller is started.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the second domain controller is started.

trans-unit.source: Note that you restart the two domain controllers so that they are not configured with the on-premises DNS servers as DNS servers.
trans-unit.target: Note that you restart the two domain controllers so that they are not configured with the on-premises DNS servers as DNS servers.

trans-unit.source: Because they are both DNS servers themselves, they are automatically configured with the on-premises DNS servers as DNS forwarders when they are promoted to domain controllers.
trans-unit.target: Because they are both DNS servers themselves, they are automatically configured with the on-premises DNS servers as DNS forwarders when they are promoted to domain controllers.

trans-unit.source: Next, you need to create an Active Directory replication site to ensure that servers in the Azure virtual network use the local domain controllers.
trans-unit.target: Next, you need to create an Active Directory replication site to ensure that servers in the Azure virtual network use the local domain controllers.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the primary domain controller with the sp_install account and run the following commands from an administrator-level Windows PowerShell command prompt:
trans-unit.target: Log on to the primary domain controller with the sp_install account and run the following commands from an administrator-level Windows PowerShell command prompt:

trans-unit.source: This diagram shows the configuration resulting from the successful completion of this phase, with placeholder computer names.
trans-unit.target: This diagram shows the configuration resulting from the successful completion of this phase, with placeholder computer names.

trans-unit.source: Next step
trans-unit.target: Next step

trans-unit.source: To continue with the configuration of this workload, go to [Phase 3: Configure SQL Server infrastructure](virtual-machines-workload-intranet-sharepoint-phase3.md).
trans-unit.target: To continue with the configuration of this workload, go to [Phase 3: Configure SQL Server infrastructure](virtual-machines-workload-intranet-sharepoint-phase3.md).
